title.narrative: Increasing access to critical dignity and menstrual hygiene service of women and girls of Reproductive Age in Jere and Mongonu LGAs of Borno State.

description.narrative:
This project is seeking to provide interventions in the following critical areas 1. Address critical dignity and menstrual hygiene needs of women and girls 2. Through establishing dignity kits production and assembly centre, improve household income and facilitate social reintegration and resilience 3. Strengthen inter agency coordination of GBV field response through co-coordination of the GBV SS
The project will work to evolve and manage a unique community facilitated strategy to the production, assembly and distribution of dignity kits for vulnerable women and girls. Specifically, the project will include a local structure for sourcing and distribution of the GBV sector approved standard dignity kits that meet the needs of women and girls of reproductive age in the project communities. This will meet the immediate, lifesaving dignity needs of women and girls of reproductive age by providing a standardised kit/package.
The project considers dignity kit production and assembly as a potential income-generating activity for women and girls affected by conflict. Rehabilitation Empowerment and Better Health Initiative (REBHI) will identify and train women and girls in production of some key items and will also be involved in the assembly process. Items that cannot be produced will be sourced locally to further contribute to the local economy. Key empowerment activities will be integrated to the production circle such as reproductive health and other public health sessions, storytelling exercises among others to promote social cohesion, reintegration and build critical mass around community/women led advocacy
REBHI will work closely with the GBV sub sector and other GBV actors to lead the implementation of the GBV SS localization strategy/action plan, as part of the localization of humanitarian response agenda. REBHI will employ 1 skilled GBV field coordinator who will support the GBV sub sector for in conducting location specific GBV service mapping, periodic gap analysis, development and strengthen referral pathways and directories, organise field coordination meetings, capacity building for field actors, periodic monitoring on behalf of the GBV SS, coordinate activities key technical working groups among others
